in a way that relates to the ability to notice something or form an opinion about something using your senses: We want to create spaces which are perceptually rich. Unusual fonts and styles stand out perceptually.
More examplesFewer examplesPerceptually, the wax object is not distinguishable from the real tomato. Should we simply accept that things are as they perceptually seem to be? Young infants have the ability to perceptually identify different speech sounds.This cycle is perceptually too slow to be experienced as a rhythm.
